personal_information.name: Igor Volodimir Vons Vons
personal_information.address: c/Comunidad de Extremadura 4, 1ºA, Barañain, Navarra, Spain

working_experience.title: Programmer/Developer
working_experience.description: Junior Developer on the web software tool Kronis

education.institution: Zespół Szkół Urszulańskich w Rybniku (Ursulines School Complex in Rybnik)

education.level: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Informatics Engineering

education.institution: Blekinge Tekniska Högskola (Blekinge Institute of Technology)

academic.title: Amazon web scraping and predictor training
academic.description: A script was designed to collect comments from various Amazon products. Pagination and request headers (e.g., user-agent) were handled to bypass page controls. The collected data was processed using embeddings and then used to train models to predict review scores based on comment text.

academic.title: Dataset regularization and machine learning model comparison
academic.description: An incomplete dataset containing economic information and bankruptcy labels was processed by filling missing values, identifying key attributes, and balancing class ratios. Multiple models were then trained and evaluated on the processed dataset.

academic.title: Image processing and classification
academic.description: This project involved processing and vectorizing an image dataset of dogs and cats. Three different encoding strategies were implemented and compared by training machine learning models.

academic.title: Dataset analysis and model training
academic.description: A dataset was selected and analyzed to study the relationship between attributes and class labels. Several models were then trained and evaluated based on the findings.

academic.title: Cell conquest/tower defense game
academic.description: A real-time multiplayer game developed in Java where players, each assigned a random country, compete by expanding their territory. The game generates units over time with the objective of being the last player standing.

academic.title: Madrid bus lines web
academic.description: A web development project that uses the public EMT API of Madrid to visualize public transport lines via Leaflet. Registered users can view bus stops, check routes, and download information as CSV or PDF. (Note: The project code was lost due to server resets by UPNA.)

academic.title: Art sales website
academic.description: A sales website developed from scratch featuring a main page with pagination and filters. Registered users can add items to their cart and perform a mock purchase, while admin users have a dedicated view for inventory management and report downloads. The project was also used to practice agile Scrum techniques.

personal.title: Translation of Qt examples from C++ to Python
personal.description: A self-initiated project to learn PySide (a Python wrapper for Qt) by translating C++ examples. Included the implementation of a simple calculator interface.

personal.title: Project Caelus
personal.description: The group project for CanSat Navarra 2020 where participants designed a mini satellite (soda can size) equipped with sensors, a transmitter, and a parachute-based descent control system.

others.title: Collaboration grant/Thesis
others.description: A project that began as a collaboration grant with UPNA and evolved into a full thesis. It involved creating a physical and reactive interface (a sand-filled box with a distance sensor and projector) to interact with generative image models. The system used network-based communication to work with Stable Diffusion and tested methodologies such as Control-Net and LoRA.

others.title: Back-end/front-end development + Kronis APIs
others.description: During a curricular internship (extended as freelance work), contributed to the Kronis web application by writing tests, refactoring code, implementing new features, developing front-end components with Django, and creating an API to facilitate a migration to a React interface.

others.title: RoboArm
others.description: A project to design and build a physical robotic arm connected to an Arduino. The arm’s position was continuously recorded and transmitted to a computer where a simulation displayed its movement. A button allowed the user to perform actions such as lifting and moving a cube with basic collision and gravity physics.

in_progress.title: Numismatics project
in_progress.description: A personal project exploring advanced 3D design and 3D printing to create an alternative preservation system for numismatic items, with tools to aid scalability and replicability.

in_progress.title: Mountain Shelters Website
in_progress.description: A collaborative project to build a website centralizing information about mountain shelters. The site displays registered shelters and allows user contributions. It began as an introductory project for .NET technologies, featuring an ASP.NET web API and a React front end, though it is not currently deployed.

future.personal_website: Create a website to showcase the resume and projects in an accessible format.

further_studies.description: Pursue an AI Master’s degree offered by UPNA for the 2025-2026 academic year. The program is a one-year master's with a sequential curriculum aimed at providing essential tools for working with new AI technologies, particularly large-scale deep learning models.

additional_info: This document is a condensed collection of various projects that showcase knowledge, experience, and future development ideas.
